channel.title: IETF on Visional
channel.description: Recent content in IETF on Visional

item.title: Networks, Identify Yourselves!
item.description: YANG, a data modeling language, has revolutionized the field of networking by providing a standardized way to define and manage network configurations. Through its hierarchical structure, expressive syntax, and platform-agnostic nature, YANG enables interoperability, automation, and scalability in network management, paving the way for more efficient and agile network infrastructures. What is YANG? In the ever-evolving landscape of networking, managing the complexity of modern networks efficiently has become paramount. Enter YANG (Yet Another Next Generation), a data modeling language standardized by the IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force), which has emerged as a game-changer in network configuration and management.

item.title: The Updated DMARC Rules
item.description: The implementation of new DMARC (Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting, and Conformance) policy rules by major email service providers, including Google, has significant implications for email security and deliverability. These stricter policies aim to combat email spoofing and phishing attacks, but they also require businesses to enhance their email authentication practices to ensure their messages are delivered reliably and securely. What This Means To You In response to the growing threat of email spoofing and phishing attacks, major email service providers, led by Google, have announced the implementation of new DMARC policy rules.
